pyrh_redesign.instrument¶

class instrument.Instrument(instrument_type, symbol)¶

A tradeable instrument on the Robinhood platform.

Methods

__init__(instrument_type, symbol)

Creates a new object which can be used to track updates about an instrument or be included in an order.

__str__()

Prints the Instruments ticket symbol

symbol()

Returns the Instrument’s ticket symbol

quote()

Returns the current market quote of the Instrument.

order_object()

Returns the users URL and the Instrument’s ticket symbol

ask_info()

The ask price and ask size of a given instrument

bid_info()

The bid price and bid size of a given instrument

fundamental()

Fundamental analysis of an instrument

historical_quotes(interval, span)

The historical data of a given instrument

news()

News relating to the given instrument

option_chain_id()

market_data()

The market_data of a given instrument

popularity()

How many users currently have this instrument

last_trade_price()

The last trading price for the given instrument

last_updated_at()

The last updated date for the given instrument

previous_close([adjusted])

The price and date of the given instrument for the previous close
class Type¶

The type of instrument in question.

Types of Instruments

Types

Defintion

STOCK

Share of the organization

BOND

A certificate issued promising to repay borrow money at a fixed interest rate at a specific time

ETF

Exchange-traded fund - holds assets such as stocks, commodities, or bonds

CRYPTO

Cryptocurrency - digital asset designed to work as a medium of exchange
__init__(instrument_type, symbol)¶

Creates a new object which can be used to track updates about an instrument or be included in an order.

Args:

instrument_type: an enum delineating the type of instrument. symbol: the symbol corresponding with the desired instrument.

Returns:

An Instrument object.

Raises:

MalformedInstrumentError: If an invalid combination of symbol and instrument type is provided.

__str__()¶

Prints the Instruments ticket symbol

symbol()¶

Returns the Instrument’s ticket symbol

quote() → dict¶

Returns the current market quote of the Instrument.

order_object() → dict¶

Returns the users URL and the Instrument’s ticket symbol

ask_info() → Tuple[decimal.Decimal, int]¶

The ask price and ask size of a given instrument

Returns:

Tuple: (ask_price, ask_size)

bid_info() → Tuple[decimal.Decimal, int]¶

The bid price and bid size of a given instrument

Returns:

Tuple: (bid_price, bid_size)

fundamental() → dict¶

Fundamental analysis of an instrument

Returns:

dict: (ask_price, ask_size) example:

{

‘open’: ‘158.310000’, ‘high’: ‘160.170000’, ‘low’: ‘155.260000’, ‘volume’: ‘4275536.000000’, ‘average_volume_2_weeks’: ‘6414987.900000’, ‘average_volume’: ‘6414987.900000’, ‘high_52_weeks’: ‘195.720000’, ‘dividend_yield’: None, ‘float’: ‘859278760.000000’, ‘low_52_weeks’: ‘115.290000’, ‘market_cap’: ‘139951150000.000000’, ‘pb_ratio’: ‘4.120950’, ‘pe_ratio’: ‘1055.130000’, ‘shares_outstanding’: ‘895000000.000000’, ‘description’: ‘salesforce.com, inc. engages in the … blah blah blah’, ‘instrument’: ‘https://api.robinhood.com/instruments/cf1d849d-06f7-4374-9e84-13129713d0c7/’, ‘ceo’: ‘Marc Russell Benioff’, ‘headquarters_city’: ‘San Francisco’, ‘headquarters_state’: ‘California’, ‘sector’: ‘Technology Services’, ‘industry’: ‘Packaged Software’, ‘num_employees’: 49000, ‘year_founded’: 1999 }

historical_quotes(interval, span) → list¶

The historical data of a given instrument

Returns:

Tuple: (ask_price, ask_size)

news() → dict¶

News relating to the given instrument

Returns:
dict:
important keys:

count: number of new items in results results: list of dict that have information regarding the intstrument

option_chain_id()¶
market_data() → dict¶

The market_data of a given instrument

Returns:
dict:
important keys:

rests: list of dict that have information regarding instrument

popularity() → dict¶

How many users currently have this instrument

Returns:

int: the number of users

last_trade_price() → decimal.Decimal¶

The last trading price for the given instrument

Returns:

Decimal value: trading price

last_updated_at() → str¶

The last updated date for the given instrument

Returns:

str: date in form ‘YYYY-MM-DD’

previous_close(adjusted=False) → Tuple[decimal.Decimal, int]¶

The price and date of the given instrument for the previous close

Returns:

tuple: (price: Decimal, date: str)
